issue.title: [CF 73] Clock timers gone. TMW not included in the addon list
issue.body:
Upon log in, I get the following error:

Message: Interface\FrameXML\UIParent.lua:2717: bad argument #1 to 'pairs' (table expected, got nil)
Time: 12/29/10 17:38:17
Count: 1
Stack: [C]: in function `pairs'
Interface\FrameXML\UIParent.lua:2717: in function `CopyTable'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:603: in function `TellMeWhen_BuildDSNTables'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen_options.lua:158: in function `TellMeWhen_Options_Compile'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:324: in function `TellMeWhen_VarsLoaded'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:632: in function <Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:630>

Locals: (*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = "table expected, got nil"
= <function> defined =[C]:-1

The clock timers for (clock spinning animation on icons) my icons are not present/do not turn. 'Highlighting' the clock timer just shows it not moving at all stuck at 12 'oclock position.

I'm not sure what caused the problem. (the above error)
However the clock timers not showing up happened around the 4.0 WoW patch, when I decided to update/clean out unused addons in my addon folder, making me wonder whether I deleted an addon required to make the clock timers work. I also decided to update TellMeWhen to its newest version on that day; and was quite impressed with the additions to the addon. However, since then the clock timers didn't work so I have been checking for new versions since (and updating) in hopes the problem would be fixed.

In an attempt to start anew, I used the 'reset profile' (something along those lines) deleted the addon in my folder, and again installed TMW to the newest version. Upon log in I noticed TMW was not apart of the listed addons in Interface->Addons, leaving me unable to add/remove/edit group icons.

All I want is the clock timers back :P but also being able to play with the Conditions of the icons is definitely a plus.

I am using TellMeWhen 2.2.3a

Attached is my saved variables.


> Posted by CurseForge user strikes_ | Imported from CurseForge issue #73 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>Saved variables of TellMeWhen</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user strikes_

I am able to make the clock timers work fine on my warlock with your settings. Try disabling all other addons and see if the problem persists. As for the LUA error, it is something stupid that I did; a fix is coming in the next version.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thanks, I'm going through my addons now to see which one in particular is causing the clock to disappear. Funny thing is, even with all other addons disabled, TMW still isn't on my Interface->addon list.

EDIT: It was an old version of Button Facade. Updating it fixed this issue, now I feel dumb thinking I did the basic "did you turn it on and off? is it plugged in?" when in a sense I didn't. Hah. All that's left is to figure out how to get TMW to show up in my interface menu.

Edited Dec 29, 2010

> Posted by CurseForge user strikes_

It not showing up in the interface menu is a bug that i am aware of, here is one way to work around it (hopefully it will work): Type the following:

/run TellMeWhen_Settings.DSN = {} ReloadUI()

(Note that this will reload your UI, so don't do it in the middle of a bossfight or something)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

thanks! strange thing is, TMW is showing properly for my other toons in the Interface->Addons menu, just not for my warlock =\

Edited Dec 30, 2010

> Posted by CurseForge user strikes_

Did you do a full reset of TMW? If so, this is why. I added a new setting in 2.3.3, but forgot to add it to the defaults, so that when you reset everything, it doesn't get the new setting.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
